intro: Cuatresia riparia var. cuspidata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved cuatresia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in riparian habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
